revisions.rev:
{{Infobox artist discography |Artist = [[Kiss (band)|Kiss]] |Image = KISS in concert Boston 2004.jpg |Studio = 20 |Studio link = Studio albums |Live = 10 |Live link = Live albums |Compilation = 11 |Comp link = Compilation albums |1Option = 5 |1Option name = Box sets |1Option color = #FFBF00 |Video = 14 |Singles = 57 |Music videos = 32 |Soundtrack = 19 |Soundtrack link = Movie soundtracks |2Option = 4 |2Option name = '78 solo albums |2Option link = '78 solo albums |2Option color = #8DB600 |3Option = 1 |3Option name = Other appearances |3Option link = Other appearances |3Option color = turquoise |References = Yes }} The [[discography]] of the [[United States|American]] [[hard rock]] band [[Kiss (band)|Kiss]] consists of 20 [[studio album]]s, 10 [[live album]]s, 13 [[compilation album]]s, 57 [[Single (music)|singles]] and 15 video albums. The group, formed in 1973, first consisted of [[bass guitar|bassist]] [[Gene Simmons]], [[rhythm guitar]]ist [[Paul Stanley]], [[lead guitar]]ist [[Ace Frehley]] and [[drums|drummer]] [[Peter Criss]]. It is the most recognizable and successful line-up, which lasted until Criss' departure in 1980. The band is known for its make-up and stage antics, which influenced many artists who later used same effects on their concerts. The band's [[Kiss (Kiss album)|eponymous debut album]] was released in 1974. Despite the constant touring and promotions, the album peaked at 87 on ''[[Billboard charts|Billboard]]'', without a benefit of a hit-single. The follow-up album, ''[[Hotter Than Hell]]'' (1974), was a bigger disappointment, peaking at 100 and quickly dropping off the charts. ''[[Dressed to Kill (album)|Dressed to Kill]]'', released in 1975, was a much better success, breaking into Top-40, but the band's record label, [[Casablanca Records]], was close to bankruptcy and needed a commercial breakthrough they'd later achieve with both Kiss' and Casablanca's Top-10 album, double-live album ''[[Alive! (Kiss album)|Alive!]]'', which featured the Top-20 hit "[[Rock and Roll All Nite]]". The next three albums, ''[[Destroyer (Kiss album)|Destroyer]]'', ''[[Rock and Roll Over]]'' and ''[[Love Gun]]'' were a success, breaking the Top-20, achieving Platinum status and spawning Top-20 singles (including the number 7 ballad "[[Beth (song)|Beth]]", band's highest charting single in the [[United States|US]]). Their seventh studio release, ''[[Dynasty (Kiss album)|Dynasty]]'' which was a musical departure, was a success although the band started losing money and fame. The next two albums, ''[[Unmasked (Kiss album)|Unmasked]]'' and ''[[Music from "The Elder"]]'', were a failure in the US but fared better over the seas, especially in [[Australia]]. Although their next studio album, ''[[Creatures of the Night]]'', was a return to their heavy metal roots, it is one of Kiss' biggest commercial failures. ''[[Lick It Up]]'' was the first album featuring the band without make-up and was certified Platinum. Their next studio releases (''[[Animalize]], [[Asylum (Kiss album)|Asylum]], [[Crazy Nights]], [[Smashes, Thrashes & Hits]]'') were more successful and Kiss had recaptured some of their earlier glory (though not to the level of their '70s heyday). ''[[Hot in the Shade]]'' was the lowest charting album of the unmasked era in the US and failed to reach Platinum status, despite the success of the Top-10 power ballad "[[Forever (Kiss song)|Forever]]". With their sixteenth studio release, ''[[Revenge (Kiss album)|Revenge]]'', the band returned to the heavy metal style. The album was a success, backed with a huge hit "[[God Gave Rock 'N' Roll to You II]]". Probably their hardest album ''[[Carnival of Souls: The Final Sessions]]'', saw the band going into the grunge movement which was seen nowhere in 1997 and was the reason, along major bootleg copies, for the album failing to reach Gold certificate in the US despite the album's lone single "Jungle" reaching number 8 on the US [[Hot Mainstream Rock Tracks]]. Followed by a highly successful reunion, in 1998 ''[[Psycho Circus]]'' was released and was more of a disappointment than a success. Their latest album, ''[[Sonic Boom (Kiss album)|Sonic Boom]]'', was released in 2009. The band is currently recording their twentieth studio album [[Monster (Kiss album)|Monster]] which is to be released in 2012. Kiss has sold over 100 million copies worldwide,{{Cite news|last=Jones |first=Emma |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment_and_arts/10105684.stm |title=Kiss: still rocking hard |publisher=BBC News |date=May 11, 2010 |accessdate=June 27, 2011}} including 20 million certified copies by the RIAA in the United States.{{cite web|title=RIAA Top Selling Artists|url=http://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?resultpage=2&table=tblTopArt&action=|accessdate=June 27, 2011}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !rowspan="2"|Year !rowspan="2"|Title ! colspan="7"|Chart position !rowspan="2"| [[Music recording sales certification|Certifications]]

| - | - | - | - | - | - |- |June 11, 2010 |align="left"|"[[Never Enough (Kiss song)|Never Enough]]" | - | - | - | - | - | - | - |} *'''A''' {{Note|A}} The single was first released with "Dirty Livin'" as the A-side and "[[Sure Know Something]]" as the B-side when it reached no. 25, and later released with "Sure Know Something" as the A-side and "Dirty Livin'" as the B-side. The singles "Beth" and "I Was Made for Lovin' You" have been certified [[RIAA certification|Gold]] by the [[RIAA]] and [[CRIA]].{{cite web|url=http://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?table=SEARCH_RESULTS&artist=Kiss%20&format=SINGLE&go=Search&perPage=50 |title=RIAA Gold and Platinum Search for singles by Kiss |publisher=Riaa.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-11}}{{cite web|url=http://www.musiccanada.com/GPSearchResult.aspx?st=&ica=False&sa=Kiss&sl=&smt=5&sat=-1&ssb=Artist |title=Music Canada Gold and Platinum Search for singles by Kiss |publisher=musiccanada.com.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-11}} The single "Psycho Circus" has been certified Gold by the IFPI Sweden.{{cite web|title=IFPI Sweden list of certificates 1987-1998|url=http://www.ifpi.se/wp/wp-content/uploads/guld-platina-1987-1998.pdf|accessdate=June 27, 2011}} ===Video albums=== {{Main|Kiss filmography}} {| class="wikitable" |- !|Year !|Title !|[[Music recording sales certification|Certifications]]
